contentrichtext.text: '''Romina Johnson''' (born 1973, [[Rome]], [[Italy]]) is a [[London]]-based [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[Soul music|soul]], [[UK garage]] and [[2-step garage|2-step]] [[singer]]. She was born in Rome to an [[United States|American]] father and an [[Italian people|Italian]] mother. Debuted in 1994 singing for the Italian TV show "Non è la RAI", where some girls sang songs using voices of professionist vocalist. Johnson was the featured vocalist on the 2000 [[hit single]], "[[Movin' Too Fast]]", by [[Artful Dodger (UK band)|The Artful Dodger]].<ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums 2">{{cite book | first= David | last= Roberts | year= 2006 | title= British Hit Singles & Albums | edition= 19th | publisher= Guinness World Records Limited | location= London | isbn= 1-904994-10-5 | page= 30}}</ref> Later that year she appeared in the [[UK Singles Chart]] for the second time with "My Forbidden Lover", featuring Luci Martin and Norma Jean.<ref name="British Hit Singles & Albums">{{cite book | first= David | last= Roberts | year= 2006 | title= British Hit Singles & Albums | edition= 19th | publisher= Guinness World Records Limited | location= London | isbn= 1-904994-10-5 | page= 287}}</ref> On the 24/10/11 broadcast of the BBC panel show Never Mind The Buzzcocks, Johnson appeared in the Identity Parade round. ==Discography== ===Compilations=== *1994 - "[[Non è la Rai novanta5]]" (track "Il vento") *1995 - "[[Non è la Rai gran finale]]" (track "Tele telefonarti") ===Singles=== *2000 - "[[Movin' Too Fast]]" *2001 - "[[My Forbidden Lover]]" *2003 - "Round & Round" on Full Flava's album ''[[Colour of My Soul]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.rominajohnson.com/ Johnson's official website] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Johnson, Romina | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British singer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1973 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Johnson, Romina}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:British female singers]] [[Category:Italian people of American descent]] [[Category:Italian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Singers from London]] [[Category:People from Rome]] {{UK-singer-stub}}
